allSaves.value: +1 status to saves against fortune or misfortune effects.

languages.details: one common regional language of the area it lives in

details.publicNotes: Diminutive little equines with bright eyes and just as many colors in their pelts as the ponies they often share habitation with, farriers tend to come out when the larger folk are not about. Assuming the place is kept clean and some milk and treats are left out on the regular, they have no problem returning the favor by mending furniture in need of it. During the night, they will tend to the hooves of kind souls, or unkind one if they treat the farriers with respect. Though not invisible, they are quite good at concealing themselves with a combination of skill and their tiny size.

description.value: Used on a hooved creature within 30 feet other than itself, the farrier delivers a small blessing. The next saving throw the creature makes within a round has its result improved by one step. While this lasts, the shoes of the creature glows with unearthly hues. If they didn't have horseshoes, they do for the duration of this effect.

The farrier Treats the Wound of a hoofed creature within melee reach as if using Combat Medicine with their Crafting skill. 

Success The creature gains a +5 status bonus to their Speed for 10 minutes. This also removes any speed penalties the creature was suffering.

Critical Success As a success, and but the speed bonus is a +10 status bonus.

Used on a hooved creature within 30 feet other than itself, the farrier delivers a small blessing. The next saving throw the creature makes within a round has its result worsened by one step. While this lasts, the shoes of the creature glows with unearthly hues. If they didn’t have horseshoes, they do for the duration of this effect.

An act of desperation, a farrier can scatter their precious horse shoes around, creating difficult terrain for any creature other than themselves and other farriers in a 10 foot burst around themselves. Any hoofed creature that moves through this space has to make a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16] save.

Success The creature is unaffected

Failure They are affected by Shoe Curse and gain a -10 foot Speed penalty while that remains.

Critical Failure As a failure, but they also become pinned for a round as their hooves stick to the floor, bound by the cursed shoes.
The Farrier is immune to attacks made with horse shoes. This applies even if they are cold iron.
